title: China Eximbank provides $52 million concessional loan for International Convention Center and Government Building Complex Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#96220, 96219)
description: On March 9, 2007, the Shanghai Construction Engineering Group (SCG) and Samoa's Ministry of Finance signed a memorandum of understanding (MOU) regarding the International Convention Center and Government Building Complex Construction Project. Then, on February 15, 2008, Chinese Ambassador Shi Longzhuang and Samoan Prime Minister Tuilaepa signed a preferential loan framework agreement for the International Convention Center and Government Building Complex Construction Project. On September 7, 2008, the Chinese Minister of Commerce Chen Deming and the Deputy Prime Minister of Samoa, Honorable Misa Telefon Retzlaff, held talks in Xiamen.  After the talks, Li Jun, Deputy Governor of China Eximbank, and Hinaray Petana, Chief Executive Officer of the Ministry of Finance of Samoa, signed a $52 million concessional loan agreement for the International Convention Center and Government Building Complex Construction Project on behalf of their governments. The loan carried the following borrowing terms: a 2% interest rate, a 20 year maturity, a 5 year grace period, a 0.75% commitment fee, and a 0.1% management fee. The proceeds of the loan were to be used by the borrower to finance a commercial contract with Shanghai Construction Engineering Group (SCG), which as signed on June 13, 2008.  The loan had achieved a 100% disbursement rate as of June 30, 2017. The borrower made principal repayments worth WST 7,226,447 between July 1, 2016 and June 30, 2017, principal repayments worth WST 7,490,188 between July 1, 2017 and June 30, 2018, principal repayments worth WST 7,440,147 between July 1, 2018 and June 30, 2019, principal repayments worth WST 7,543,490 between July 1, 2019 and June 30, 2020, and no principal repayments between July 1, 2020 and June 30, 2021. The loan's amount outstanding was WST 117,187,500 as of June 30, 2013, WST 109,143,827 as of June 30, 2014, WST 115,798,180 as of June 30, 2015, WST 98,286,290 as of June 30, 2016, WST 85,812,695 as of June 30, 2017, WST 83,448,919 as of June 30, 2018, WST 74,037,046 as of June 30, 2019, WST 65,905,764 as of June 30, 2020 and WST 61,377,927 as of June 30, 2021.   The purpose of the project was to construct a 6-story, 2500 square foot government office complex (that can house ten government ministries and corporations and offices of four ministers) and an international convention center (located behind the government office complex) with seating capacity for 450 people. The convention center is fully equipped with interpreter rooms, video conference systems and a state of the art PA sound system. It also has a VIP room that can be partitioned and is fully air conditioned. The government office complex and international convention center are located on the old site of the Western Samoa Trust Estate Corporation (WSTEC) — and later the Siva Afi Entertainment Centre — in the Sogi neighborhood within the capital city of Apia.   SCG was the contractor responsible for implementation. On September 17, 2008, the Government of Samoa held the unveiling ceremony for the project design plan. Then, on January 25, 2010, a groundbreaking ceremony took place. The project completion and handover ceremony took place on November 4, 2011.  There are some indications that the China Eximbank loan for the International Convention Center and Government Building Complex Construction Project has financially underperformed vis-a-vis the original expectations of the lender. In 2020, as part of G20's Debt Service Suspension Initiative (DSSI), China Eximbank and the Government of Samoa signed a debt suspension agreement. Under the terms of the agreement, the lender agreed to suspend principal and interest payments due between May 1, 2020 and December 31, 2020 under multiple loan agreements, including the loan agreement for the International Convention Center and Government Building Complex Construction Project. The total estimated suspension amount is $21,906,085. Then, in 2021, China Eximbank and the Government of Samoa signed another debt suspension agreement. Under the terms of the agreement, the lender agreed to suspend principal and interest payments due in 2021 under multiple loan agreements, including the loan agreement for the International Convention Center and Government Building Complex Construction Project. The total estimated suspension amount was $16,436,000 ($13,506,000 in principal payments and $2,929,000 in interest payments). The 2020 debt rescheduling is captured via Project ID#96220. The 2021 debt rescheduling is captured via Project ID#96219.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the Government Building Project, the Comprehensive Government Office Building Project, the Samoa New Government Office Building Complex and Convention Centre Project, and the Government Comprehensive Office Building and International Conference Center Project. The government building complex is known locally as the Tui Atua Tupua Tamasese Efi (TATTE) building complex. The Chinese project title is 萨摩亚独立国政府新建综合办公楼项目 or 政府综合办公楼及国际会议中心项目 or 萨摩亚政府办公楼及会议中心 .2. The Government of Samoa loan identification number for this project is 2008002.3. This project is distinct from the China Eximbank-financed Parliamentary Complex & MJCA Building Construction Project (captured via Project ID#64034).4. The amounts outstanding and repayments data are drawn from the annual Public Accounts of Samoa’s Ministry of Finance: https://www.dropbox.com/s/mqx2n1f5zvzh1l0/Public-Accounts-2014.pdf?dl=0 and https://www.dropbox.com/s/p93si5mz4lpapns/Public-Accounts-2015.pdf?dl=0 and https://www.dropbox.com/s/fye48g5n4yylqgk/Public-Accounts-2016.pdf?dl=0 and https://www.dropbox.com/s/hm8oorga2sqi9na/Public-Account-FY-2017.pdf?dl=0 and https://www.dropbox.com/s/n6miez702ndycis/Public-Accounts-2018.pdf?dl=0 and https://www.dropbox.com/s/1kh3a47s4i2oh3r/Public-Accounts-2019-.pdf?dl=0 and https://www.dropbox.com/s/3i4r1bd0ctjlumo/Public-Accounts-2020.pdf?dl=0 and https://www.dropbox.com/s/jt0expsqan3uy2n/Public-Accounts-2021.pdf?dl=0
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
China Eximbank provides $52 million concessional loan for International Convention Center and Government Building Complex Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#96220, 96219)

# Description
On March 9, 2007, the Shanghai Construction Engineering Group (SCG) and Samoa's Ministry of Finance signed a memorandum of understanding (MOU) regarding the International Convention Center and Government Building Complex Construction Project. Then, on February 15, 2008, Chinese Ambassador Shi Longzhuang and Samoan Prime Minister Tuilaepa signed a preferential loan framework agreement for the International Convention Center and Government Building Complex Construction Project. On September 7, 2008, the Chinese Minister of Commerce Chen Deming and the Deputy Prime Minister of Samoa, Honorable Misa Telefon Retzlaff, held talks in Xiamen.  After the talks, Li Jun, Deputy Governor of China Eximbank, and Hinaray Petana, Chief Executive Officer of the Ministry of Finance of Samoa, signed a $52 million concessional loan agreement for the International Convention Center and Government Building Complex Construction Project on behalf of their governments. The loan carried the following borrowing terms: a 2% interest rate, a 20 year maturity, a 5 year grace period, a 0.75% commitment fee, and a 0.1% management fee. The proceeds of the loan were to be used by the borrower to finance a commercial contract with Shanghai Construction Engineering Group (SCG), which as signed on June 13, 2008.  The loan had achieved a 100% disbursement rate as of June 30, 2017. The borrower made principal repayments worth WST 7,226,447 between July 1, 2016 and June 30, 2017, principal repayments worth WST 7,490,188 between July 1, 2017 and June 30, 2018, principal repayments worth WST 7,440,147 between July 1, 2018 and June 30, 2019, principal repayments worth WST 7,543,490 between July 1, 2019 and June 30, 2020, and no principal repayments between July 1, 2020 and June 30, 2021. The loan's amount outstanding was WST 117,187,500 as of June 30, 2013, WST 109,143,827 as of June 30, 2014, WST 115,798,180 as of June 30, 2015, WST 98,286,290 as of June 30, 2016, WST 85,812,695 as of June 30, 2017, WST 83,448,919 as of June 30, 2018, WST 74,037,046 as of June 30, 2019, WST 65,905,764 as of June 30, 2020 and WST 61,377,927 as of June 30, 2021.   The purpose of the project was to construct a 6-story, 2500 square foot government office complex (that can house ten government ministries and corporations and offices of four ministers) and an international convention center (located behind the government office complex) with seating capacity for 450 people. The convention center is fully equipped with interpreter rooms, video conference systems and a state of the art PA sound system. It also has a VIP room that can be partitioned and is fully air conditioned. The government office complex and international convention center are located on the old site of the Western Samoa Trust Estate Corporation (WSTEC) — and later the Siva Afi Entertainment Centre — in the Sogi neighborhood within the capital city of Apia.   SCG was the contractor responsible for implementation. On September 17, 2008, the Government of Samoa held the unveiling ceremony for the project design plan. Then, on January 25, 2010, a groundbreaking ceremony took place. The project completion and handover ceremony took place on November 4, 2011.  There are some indications that the China Eximbank loan for the International Convention Center and Government Building Complex Construction Project has financially underperformed vis-a-vis the original expectations of the lender. In 2020, as part of G20's Debt Service Suspension Initiative (DSSI), China Eximbank and the Government of Samoa signed a debt suspension agreement. Under the terms of the agreement, the lender agreed to suspend principal and interest payments due between May 1, 2020 and December 31, 2020 under multiple loan agreements, including the loan agreement for the International Convention Center and Government Building Complex Construction Project. The total estimated suspension amount is $21,906,085. Then, in 2021, China Eximbank and the Government of Samoa signed another debt suspension agreement. Under the terms of the agreement, the lender agreed to suspend principal and interest payments due in 2021 under multiple loan agreements, including the loan agreement for the International Convention Center and Government Building Complex Construction Project. The total estimated suspension amount was $16,436,000 ($13,506,000 in principal payments and $2,929,000 in interest payments). The 2020 debt rescheduling is captured via Project ID#96220. The 2021 debt rescheduling is captured via Project ID#96219.
justification: Project focuses on construction of government office complex and convention center without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of 6-story government office complex and international convention center with seating capacity for 450 people, no mention of energy or environmental components

title: China sponsored a journalist tour of several cities throughout China for journalists from Samoa
description: In 2008 China sponsored a journalist tour of several cities throughout China for journalists from Samoa.  They were also present for the meeting of Samoan and Chinese dignitaries, and the trade expo.   The New York Times reports that a Media Tour in April 2008 was disrupted by Tibetan Monks waving the Tibetan flag. It is also possible the Media Tour was related to the 2008 Olympics, hosted in Beijing. It is unclear if this tour of Samoan journalists was one of the tours disrupted by the Tibetan demonstrations.
combined_text:
# Sector
COMMUNICATIONS

# Title
China sponsored a journalist tour of several cities throughout China for journalists from Samoa

# Description
In 2008 China sponsored a journalist tour of several cities throughout China for journalists from Samoa.  They were also present for the meeting of Samoan and Chinese dignitaries, and the trade expo.   The New York Times reports that a Media Tour in April 2008 was disrupted by Tibetan Monks waving the Tibetan flag. It is also possible the Media Tour was related to the 2008 Olympics, hosted in Beijing. It is unclear if this tour of Samoan journalists was one of the tours disrupted by the Tibetan demonstrations.
justification: Project focuses on cultural exchange and media relations without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Journalist tour, cultural exchange, media relations, no mention of energy or infrastructure components

title: Chinese Government provides grant for Vaitele Primary School Renovation Project
description: On March 5, 2008, the Chinese Government and the Government of Samoa signed an exchange of notes, which committed an unspecified amount of grant funding for the Vaitele Primary School Renovation Project.   The purpose of this project was to renovate a primary school (known as Vaitele-Uta Primary School) in the village of Vaitele (Vaitele-Uta) on the island of Upolu, 3 km from the Central Business District (CBD) of Apia. Shanghai Construction Engineering Group was the contractor responsible for implementation. On August 21, 2009, a groundbreaking ceremony took place. Then, on April 14, 2010, a handover ceremony for the project took place.
staff_comments: This project is also known as the Vaitele-Uta Primary School Construction Project. The Chinese project title is 瓦伊特莱小学维修项目.
combined_text:

The purpose of this project was to renovate a primary school (known as Vaitele-Uta Primary School) in the village of Vaitele (Vaitele-Uta) on the island of Upolu, 3 km from the Central Business District (CBD) of Apia. Shanghai Construction Engineering Group was the contractor responsible for implementation. On August 21, 2009, a groundbreaking ceremony took place. justification: Project focuses on education infrastructure renovation without direct environmental or energy transition impacts

title: China donates sewing machine to women's committee in Samoa
description: On February 14, 2008, the Chinese Ambassador to Samoa visited the Women's Committee of Sapaia Village, and donated a sewing machine. The sewing machine will play a role to improve women's life skills and increase employment opportunities in Samoa.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title

# Description
On February 14, 2008, the Chinese Ambassador to Samoa visited the Women's Committee of Sapaia Village, and donated a sewing machine. The sewing machine will play a role to improve women's life skills and increase employment opportunities in Samoa.
justification: Project focuses on social development and women's empowerment without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of sewing machine to improve life skills and employment opportunities

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 10 million grant for provision of office equipment to University of Belgrade
description: On Sept. 5, 2008, Chinese government signed a donation agreement with Serbian government for the provision of a 10 million yuan worth of office equipment to University of Belgrade. The equipments was shipped to Serbia on June 19, 2009, and was installed by July 5, 2009. China Light Industrial Corporation for Foreign Economic and Technical Co-operation (CLETC) was the contractor for the provision and shipment of the donated equipment.   On July 6, 2009, the handover ceremony of the 10-million CNY worth of Chinese donation of office equipments and vocal laboratory equipments was held at the University of Belgrade. The materials were intended to assist the University of Belgrade Computer and Speech Lab. Chinese Ambassador to Serbia Wei Jinghua and Serbian Finance Minister Diane Delagudi Norwich and other 60 people attended the handover ceremony.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Government provides RMB 10 million grant for provision of office equipment to University of Belgrade

# Description
On Sept. 5, 2008, Chinese government signed a donation agreement with Serbian government for the provision of a 10 million yuan worth of office equipment to University of Belgrade. The equipments was shipped to Serbia on June 19, 2009, and was installed by July 5, 2009. China Light Industrial Corporation for Foreign Economic and Technical Co-operation (CLETC) was the contractor for the provision and shipment of the donated equipment.   On July 6, 2009, the handover ceremony of the 10-million CNY worth of Chinese donation of office equipments and vocal laboratory equipments was held at the University of Belgrade. The materials were intended to assist the University of Belgrade Computer and Speech Lab. Chinese Ambassador to Serbia Wei Jinghua and Serbian Finance Minister Diane Delagudi Norwich and other 60 people attended the handover ceremony.
justification: Project focuses on educational equipment donation without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Office equipment and vocal laboratory equipment for university, educational purpose

title: Chinese Government provides $3.5 million grant for Anse Royale Hospital Rehabilitation Project
description: On June 26, 2008, the Chinese Government and the Government of Seychelles signed a grant agreement for the Anse Royale Hospital Rehabilitation Project. China’s Ministry of Commerce was the source of funding and it committed $3.5 million of grant funding in total.    This project involved the rehabilitation of the country’s second-largest (54-bed) hospital (Anse Royale Hospital), which is located on Baie Lazare Route in the Anse Royale administrative district. It has a rehabilitation and physiotherapy room, a labor room, an accident and emergency unit with a special treatment room and its own reception as well as an operating theatre and X-ray facilities.   China Qingdao Construction Group Corporation (now known as Qingjiang Group), which was a state-owned enterprise until 2015, was the contractor responsible for implementation. The foundation-laying ceremony was held on June 16, 2009, but construction did not start until July 9, 2009. Construction was completed on April 19, 2011 and an opening ceremony for the hospital was held on June 15, 2013. As of 2015, the hospital reportedly suffered from a lack of fans, air conditioners, and space.
staff_comments: The Chinese project title is 安塞医院项目 or 援塞舌尔安塞罗亚莱区医院项目. According to archival records, the provision of medical services at Anse Royale started in 1906 when a dispensary was created and a resident British medical officer was posted to serve the south region of Mahé.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government provides $3.5 million grant for Anse Royale Hospital Rehabilitation Project

# Description
On June 26, 2008, the Chinese Government and the Government of Seychelles signed a grant agreement for the Anse Royale Hospital Rehabilitation Project. China’s Ministry of Commerce was the source of funding and it committed $3.5 million of grant funding in total.    This project involved the rehabilitation of the country’s second-largest (54-bed) hospital (Anse Royale Hospital), which is located on Baie Lazare Route in the Anse Royale administrative district. It has a rehabilitation and physiotherapy room, a labor room, an accident and emergency unit with a special treatment room and its own reception as well as an operating theatre and X-ray facilities.   China Qingdao Construction Group Corporation (now known as Qingjiang Group), which was a state-owned enterprise until 2015, was the contractor responsible for implementation. The foundation-laying ceremony was held on June 16, 2009, but construction did not start until July 9, 2009. Construction was completed on April 19, 2011 and an opening ceremony for the hospital was held on June 15, 2013. As of 2015, the hospital reportedly suffered from a lack of fans, air conditioners, and space.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare infrastructure rehabilitation with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Rehabilitation of 54-bed hospital, includes medical facilities but no energy or environmental components mentioned

title: China begins training for their second team of youth volunteers from Guangzhou City who are to be sent to the Seychelles
description: On March 13, 2008, Guangzhou City (Guangdong Province) sent the second team of 12 youth volunteers for a one-year mission in Seychelles. The 12 volunteers include 7 doctors/nurses, 3 teachers (music and Chinese), and 2 sports coaches. This is the second time China has sent youth volunteers since 2007. The volunteers returned to China in April 2009.   Related to projects: #35286, #35283,#35284,#35285, #34184
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER MULTISECTOR

# Title
China begins training for their second team of youth volunteers from Guangzhou City who are to be sent to the Seychelles

# Description
On March 13, 2008, Guangzhou City (Guangdong Province) sent the second team of 12 youth volunteers for a one-year mission in Seychelles. The 12 volunteers include 7 doctors/nurses, 3 teachers (music and Chinese), and 2 sports coaches. This is the second time China has sent youth volunteers since 2007. The volunteers returned to China in April 2009.   Related to projects: #35286, #35283,#35284,#35285, #34184
justification: Project focuses on sending youth volunteers for social development purposes, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Volunteers include doctors/nurses, teachers, and sports coaches; mission focused on social services in Seychelles

title: Chinese Government Provides RMB 20 Million via a November 2008 ETCA Due to 2008 Global Recession
description: On November 13, 2008, the Chinese Government signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) committing to grant $1.46 million USD in cash assistance to the Government of Seychelles in light of the 2008 global recession. The check was officially handed over on December 26, 2008.
combined_text:
# Sector
GENERAL BUDGET SUPPORT

# Title
Chinese Government Provides RMB 20 Million via a November 2008 ETCA Due to 2008 Global Recession

# Description
On November 13, 2008, the Chinese Government signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) committing to grant $1.46 million USD in cash assistance to the Government of Seychelles in light of the 2008 global recession. The check was officially handed over on December 26, 2008.
justification: General budget support without specific environmental or energy transition focus
evidence: Cash assistance provided through Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement, no specific project details provided

title: China donates 3,500 tons of corn to Seychelles
description: On June 27, 2008, the Chinese Ambassador officially donated 3,500 tons of corn to the Seychelles Minister of Environment, Natural Resources and Transportation.  The value of the corn is unknown.

title: Chinese Government dispatches 12th medical team to Victoria Hospital
description: Since 1986, Shandong Province has been sending medical teams to Seychelles every two years.   On August 10, 2008, the governments of China and Seychelles exchanged letters confirming that the Chinese Government would dispatch the 12th Chinese medical team to Seychelles (第12批援塞舌尔医疗队). The 6-member team was stationed at Victoria Hospital in the the capital city of Victoria. It completed its term of service between 2008 and 2010.
combined_text:

The 6-member team was stationed at Victoria Hospital in the the capital city of Victoria. It completed its term of service between 2008 and 2010.
